solution_line_template: First find the total cost of the broccoli: {broccoli_pounds} pounds * ${broccoli_price_per_pound}/pound = $<<{broccoli_pounds}*{broccoli_price_per_pound}={broccoli_total}>>{broccoli_total}
Then find the total cost of the oranges: {orange_count} oranges * ${orange_price_each}/orange = $<<{orange_count}*{orange_price_each}={orange_total}>>{orange_total}
Then find the total cost of the vegetables: ${broccoli_total} + ${orange_total} + ${cabbage_price} = $<<{broccoli_total}+{orange_total}+{cabbage_price}={vegetable_total}>>{vegetable_total}
Then find the total cost of the chicken: ${chicken_price_per_pound}/pound * {chicken_pounds} pounds = $<<{chicken_price_per_pound}*{chicken_pounds}={chicken_total}>>{chicken_total}
Then add the cost of the bacon to find the total cost of the meat: ${chicken_total} + ${bacon_price} = $<<{chicken_total}+{bacon_price}={meat_total}>>{meat_total}
Then add the cost of the meat and vegetables to find the total cost of the groceries: ${meat_total} + ${vegetable_total} = $<<{meat_total}+{vegetable_total}={grocery_total}>>{grocery_total}

Then divide the cost of the meat by the total grocery bill and multiply by 100% to express the answer as a percentage: ${meat_total} / ${grocery_total} * {percent_factor}% = 33.333%, which rounds down to 33%
